violations.description: No try-catch block found. MongoNetworkError, MongoServerSelectionError, MongoNetworkTimeoutError, or MongoError - this will crash the application.
violations.suggested_fix: Caller MUST catch connection errors and handle them separately from query errors. Implement retry logic with exponential backoff for transient connection issues. Log connection errors for operations monitoring.

lines.content: * ❌ Multiple collection instances without error handling

violations.description: No try-catch block found. MongoServerError, MongoNetworkError, or MongoError - this will crash the application.
violations.suggested_fix: Caller MUST catch query errors. Network errors (MongoNetworkError) may be transient and can be retried. Invalid query errors (MongoServerError) should not be retried.

violations.description: No try-catch block found. MongoServerError with error.code === 11000 - this will crash the application.
violations.suggested_fix: Caller MUST catch duplicate key errors (code 11000) and handle gracefully. Extract conflicting field from error message. DO NOT retry without changing the unique field value.

violations.description: No try-catch block found. MongoServerError, MongoWriteConcernError, or MongoError - this will crash the application.
violations.suggested_fix: Caller MUST catch update errors. Network errors may be transient. Invalid update operators (MongoServerError) should not be retried.

violations.description: No try-catch block found. MongoServerError with error.code === 11000 - this will crash the application.
violations.suggested_fix: Caller MUST catch duplicate key errors (code 11000) and handle gracefully. Extract conflicting field from error message. DO NOT retry without changing the unique field value.

violations.description: No try-catch block found. MongoServerError, MongoWriteConcernError, or MongoError - this will crash the application.
violations.suggested_fix: Caller MUST catch delete errors. Deleting non-existent document is NOT an error (deletedCount = 0). Network errors may be transient and retriable.
